title: Italian Master Drawings from the British Royal Collection: Leonardo to Canaletto
description: This traveling exhibition developed out of the exhibition Master Drawings in the Royal Collection, which was shown at the Queen's Gallery in Buckingham Palace in April 1986. The selection of 61 Italian drawings, an area for which the Royal Collection is most renowned, included 7 works by Leonardo da Vinci, 4 drawings by Michelangelo, and 3 drawings by Raphael. Drawings by Domenico Ghirlandaio, Annibale Caracci, Bernini, Guercino, and Canaletto were also on view. In addition to the Art Institute of Chicago the exhibition traveled to the National Gallery of Art in Washington D.C. and the Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco.

input: Italian Master Drawings from the British Royal Collection: Leonardo to Canaletto
